titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Charles William Eliot papers, 1884-1910
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Miscellaneous correspondence regarding appointments and invitations. Includes a letter from Eliot to Dr. Sereno Watson, accepting his resignation as instructor of phytography (botany); a letter regarding a speaking engagement by Eliot at the University Club; and a letter declining to participate in a medal ceremony for Boston citizens' extraordinary service.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Charles William Eliot Papers, 1884-1910, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous correspondence regarding appointments and invitations. Includes a letter from Eliot to Dr. Sereno Watson, accepting his resignation as instructor of phytography (botany); a letter regarding a speaking engagement by Eliot at the University Club; and a letter declining to participate in a medal ceremony for Boston citizens' extraordinary service.

odd.p: Cataloged from card file; description dates from 1973.
